resources.string: Pac-Man is a classic arcade game released in 1980 by Japanese game developer Namco. It is considered one of the most iconic and influential games of all time and has since been ported to numerous gaming platforms. In the game, the player controls a yellow, circular character named Pac-Man, who must navigate a maze while consuming dots and avoiding four ghosts. The game\'s objective is to clear all the dots on the screen while avoiding the ghosts. If Pac-Man comes into contact with a ghost, he loses a life. The game ends when all of Pac-Man\'s lives are lost.

Super Mario is a popular video game franchise created by Japanese game designer Shigeru Miyamoto and developed by Nintendo. The franchise first appeared in 1985 with the release of the original Super Mario Bros. game for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). The games in the franchise typically feature a character named Mario, who must navigate through various levels and obstacles to rescue a damsel in distress, Princess Peach, from the primary antagonist, Bowser. Along the way, Mario collects power-ups, such as mushrooms and fire flowers, that give him special abilities, such as growing in size and shooting fireballs.

Star Wars is a classic arcade game released in 1983 by Atari. The game was inspired by the original Star Wars trilogy and allowed players to pilot an X-wing fighter through various missions. The games objective was to destroy the Death Star, a powerful weapon capable of destroying planets, while avoiding obstacles and enemy fire. The gameplay consisted of a first-person perspective with vector graphics, giving the game a unique look and feel.
